instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1932 Macbook Air 2018-2019 820-01521 J6100 Connector
threads.message:
Got this unit with a burned up J6100 connector. Has anyone had any luck replacing this connector? Any pointers on replacing (heat temp, etc)? Are the connectors available yet anywhere to purchase? I have a feeling this is going to be a normal issue with water damage on these. This is the 2nd one I've seen with this issue and I don't see these very often.

Thanks

Brad

threads.title: A1932 Macbook Air 2018-2019 820-01521 J6100 Connector
threads.message:
Many pins there go directly to T2 chip.
I remember a thread where burnt connector ended in dead T2.
You should remove it first and check diode mode on affected lines.

threads.title: A1932 Macbook Air 2018-2019 820-01521 J6100 Connector
threads.message: After placing a little flux on the pins, I usually preheat the whole board with a heat gun (the kind you find at Lowe’s), before using the reflow station heat gun set at 350-365. Just be patient and also suggest trying this on a donor board first.

threads.title: A1932 Macbook Air 2018-2019 820-01521 J6100 Connector
threads.message:
Awesome feedback!! I will try both. Does anybody know where to purchase the connector if it is available? Or are you just removing the connector from donor boards?

Thanks
